Class Trapper

java.lang.Object
  Animal
      Trapper
All Implemented Interfaces:
Actor, Predator
public class Trapper
extends Animal
implements Predator

A simple model of a trapper. Trapperes age, move, eat rabbits, and die.

Version:
2007.08.14
Author:
David J. Barnes, Michael Kolling, and Steffen L. Norgren

Constructor Detail

Trapper

public Trapper(boolean randomAge)
Create a trapper. A trapper can be created as a new born (age zero and not hungry) or with random age.

Parameters:
randomAge - If true, the trapper will have random age and hunger level.
Method Detail

act

public void act(Field currentField,
                Field updatedField,
                java.util.List<Animal> newAnimals)
This is what the trapper does most of the time: it hunts for rabbits. In the process, it might breed, die of hunger, or die of old age.

Specified by:
act in interface Actor
Parameters:
currentField - The field currently occupied.
updatedField - The field to transfer to.
newAnimals - A list to add newly born trapperes to.
